trans-unit.source: Invoicing

seg-source.mrk: Invoicing

trans-unit.source: Invoicing of the Rent Order starts with the shipment of the document lines. If the complete quantity is shipped, the contract is ready for invoicing with its particular due date. This due date is dependent on the specific Invoice Period (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref236733482" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Invoicing Parameters” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Invoicing of the Rent Order starts with the shipment of the document lines.
If the complete quantity is shipped, the contract is ready for invoicing with its particular due date.

This due date is dependent on the specific Invoice Period (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref236733482" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Invoicing Parameters” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: The amount that will be invoiced is calculated from the Rate Unit Price. If the rate period is Quarter, Year or any other period that can be assembled by months, the period is divided into months in case no full rate period can be invoiced. If a division has to be done by date, the system uses the actual number of days to determine the price per day.

seg-source.mrk: The amount that will be invoiced is calculated from the Rate Unit Price.
If the rate period is Quarter, Year or any other period that can be assembled by months, the period is divided into months in case no full rate period can be invoiced.
If a division has to be done by date, the system uses the actual number of days to determine the price per day.

trans-unit.source: Example

seg-source.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: If the Invoice Period is set to Month and the Month Based check box is selected, the first invoice for a contract line from May 15th to August 31st will contain a first invoicing period from May 15th to May 31st. This means that if the Rate Unit Price is based on the monthly rate of 310.00 then:

seg-source.mrk: If the Invoice Period is set to Month and the Month Based check box is selected, the first invoice for a contract line from May 15th to August 31st will contain a first invoicing period from May 15th to May 31st.
This means that if the Rate Unit Price is based on the monthly rate of 310.00 then:

trans-unit.source: the daily price is 310 / 31 (number of days in May) = 10.00

seg-source.mrk: the daily price is 310 / 31 (number of days in May) = 10.00

trans-unit.source: the invoicing amount calculates from 10.00 * 17 (days) = 170.00

seg-source.mrk: the invoicing amount calculates from 10.00 * 17 (days) = 170.00

trans-unit.source: The following parameters drive the invoicing of rent orders:

seg-source.mrk: The following parameters drive the invoicing of rent orders:

trans-unit.source: Invoice Periods and Month Based Date Calculations

seg-source.mrk: Invoice Periods and Month Based Date Calculations

trans-unit.source: For an Invoice Period of Month that does not use the Month Based option, the period always uses the Microsoft Dynamics NAV date formula of +1M-1D. This means it starts at the Next Invoice Period Start Date and adds this date formula to determine the Next Invoice Period End Date.

seg-source.mrk: For an Invoice Period of Month that does not use the Month Based option, the period always uses the Microsoft Dynamics NAV date formula of +1M-1D.
This means it starts at the Next Invoice Period Start Date and adds this date formula to determine the Next Invoice Period End Date.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for calendar months, when the rental begins January 1st, the invoice will end on January 31st because one month is added (February 1st) and then backed up one day.

seg-source.mrk: This is useful for calendar months, when the rental begins January 1st, the invoice will end on January 31st because one month is added (February 1st) and then backed up one day.

trans-unit.source: The same is done if it not the calendar month: the start date for invoicing is the Rental Start Date if no invoicing has occurred or it is the last invoiced date +1.

seg-source.mrk: The same is done if it not the calendar month: the start date for invoicing is the Rental Start Date if no invoicing has occurred or it is the last invoiced date +1.

trans-unit.source: The End Date is calculated by using the following date formulas:

seg-source.mrk: The End Date is calculated by using the following date formulas:

trans-unit.source: +CY

seg-source.mrk: +CY

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if the last day was not invoiced in the last invoice created, it will be included in the next invoice. However, the system does not stop at the Rental End Date automatically, so if no return has been posted when the invoice is created, the system creates an invoice for a full invoicing period (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Returns.htm#_Ref355092985" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Returns” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Therefore, if the last day was not invoiced in the last invoice created, it will be included in the next invoice.

However, the system does not stop at the Rental End Date automatically, so if no return has been posted when the invoice is created, the system creates an invoice for a full invoicing period (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Returns.htm#_Ref355092985" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Returns” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: If a Calendar Code is entered to the Rent Order line the invoice amounts are calculated from the Rental Price for the invoicing period minus the price for free days within the period.

seg-source.mrk: If a Calendar Code is entered to the Rent Order line the invoice amounts are calculated from the Rental Price for the invoicing period minus the price for free days within the period.

trans-unit.source: Invoice Periods and Prepaid Date Calculations

seg-source.mrk: Invoice Periods and Prepaid Date Calculations

trans-unit.source: If the Prepaid check box is selected on the line, the due date is the Next Invoice Period starting date. If the Prepaid check box is not selected, the due date is the Next Invoice Period end date.

seg-source.mrk: If the Prepaid check box is selected on the line, the due date is the Next Invoice Period starting date.
If the Prepaid check box is not selected, the due date is the Next Invoice Period end date.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a rental period is April 15th through December 31st, the Invoice Period is Month, the Prepaid check box is selected, and the invoice is to be created through May 15th:

seg-source.mrk: For example, if a rental period is April 15th through December 31st, the Invoice Period is Month, the Prepaid check box is selected, and the invoice is to be created through May 15th:

trans-unit.source: The first invoice period starts on April 15th and ends on May 14th. This is because the Start Date of the period is the due date of it.

seg-source.mrk: The first invoice period starts on April 15th and ends on May 14th.
This is because the Start Date of the period is the due date of it.

trans-unit.source: The second starts on May 15th and ends on June 14th. This period is due on May 15th so the system creates invoices up to June 14th.

seg-source.mrk: The second starts on May 15th and ends on June 14th.
This period is due on May 15th so the system creates invoices up to June 14th.

trans-unit.source: A single line is created for the portion of the year, from 4/15 – 12/31 (16 days / 30 days x 125 unit price = 66.67 (April) + 1000.00 (eight months unit price) = 1066.67).

trans-unit.source: Calendar Codes

seg-source.mrk: Calendar Codes

trans-unit.source: Calendar Codes are linked to the Base Calendar Card, where a company sets up a base calendar on a general level and defines each date as either a working or nonworking day. For example, a base calendar for a particular country/region would define weekends and national holidays as nonworking days. All other days would be working days.

seg-source.mrk: Calendar Codes are linked to the Base Calendar Card, where a company sets up a base calendar on a general level and defines each date as either a working or nonworking day.
For example, a base calendar for a particular country/region would define weekends and national holidays as nonworking days.
All other days would be working days.

trans-unit.source: cc|rental uses one day as a base unit of measure. Prices are calculated for the whole or a part of the Invoicing Period that is shown on the Rent Order (or Quote) or are transferred to the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: cc|rental uses one day as a base unit of measure.
Prices are calculated for the whole or a part of the Invoicing Period that is shown on the Rent Order (or Quote) or are transferred to the invoice.

trans-unit.source: If a Calendar Code is entered on a Rent Order line (or on the Rental FastTab and defaulted to the lines) and nonworking days are identified for the period to be calculated, the price for the period is calculated and then cc|rental subtracts one day’s price for each nonworking day.

seg-source.mrk: If a Calendar Code is entered on a Rent Order line (or on the Rental FastTab and defaulted to the lines) and nonworking days are identified for the period to be calculated, the price for the period is calculated and then cc|rental subtracts one day’s price for each nonworking day.

trans-unit.source: Specific calendar changes can be set up for each line by clicking Line > Cust. Calendar on the Lines FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Specific calendar changes can be set up for each line by clicking <span class="Bold">Line > Cust.
Calendar on the Lines FastTab.

trans-unit.source: : Customized Calendar Entries opened from Rent Order line

seg-source.mrk: : Customized Calendar Entries opened from Rent Order line

trans-unit.source: Invoice Processing

seg-source.mrk: Invoice Processing

trans-unit.source: After selecting the Invoice option in the Post page, the “Create Rental Contract Invoice” report opens, filtered on the rent order. A posting date and date filter for the last due date included must be entered. Both fields are filled with the work date by default.

seg-source.mrk: After selecting the Invoice option in the Post page, the “Create Rental Contract Invoice” report opens, filtered on the rent order.
A posting date and date filter for the last due date included must be entered.
Both fields are filled with the work date by default.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the Posting Date / Work Date are correct before running the batch job.

seg-source.mrk: Ensure that the Posting Date / Work Date are correct before running the batch job.

trans-unit.source: : Create Rental Contract Invoice report request page opened from the rent order

seg-source.mrk: : Create Rental Contract Invoice report request page opened from the rent order

trans-unit.source: The Action field determines if invoices are created or if a preview invoice is generated. If the Print Only option is selected, the “Rental Contract Invoicing - Test” report opens with the ability to Print or Preview the invoice without posting.

seg-source.mrk: The Action field determines if invoices are created or if a preview invoice is generated.
If the Print Only option is selected, the “Rental Contract Invoicing - Test” report opens with the ability to Print or Preview the invoice without posting.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Contract Invoicing - Test report request page opened from Create Rental Contract Invoice report

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Contract Invoicing - Test report request page opened from Create Rental Contract Invoice report

trans-unit.source: The invoicing date must be entered so the preview uses the same preconditions as the invoice to be created. This is only a preview, with no effect on the on existing data.

seg-source.mrk: The invoicing date must be entered so the preview uses the same preconditions as the invoice to be created.
This is only a preview, with no effect on the on existing data.

trans-unit.source: Rental Ledger Entries

seg-source.mrk: Rental Ledger Entries

trans-unit.source: Each rent order line gets Rental Ledger Entries on creation of the Invoice (Service Invoice). Rental Ledger Entries are accessed from the Rent Order by clicking Navigate > Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

seg-source.mrk: Each rent order line gets Rental Ledger Entries on creation of the Invoice (Service Invoice).
Rental Ledger Entries are accessed from the Rent Order by clicking Navigate > Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Ledger Entries with posted and un-posted invoice lines for a sales item, resource, and rental item

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Ledger Entries with posted and un-posted invoice lines for a sales item, resource, and rental item

trans-unit.source: These ledger entries are marked as Open until they are closed by posting the invoice. They contain the Entry Type, No. (Item, Resource, G/L account or Service Contract = rental item) and serial numbers where applicable. They also carry information about the period that is invoiced with that entry.

seg-source.mrk: These ledger entries are marked as Open until they are closed by posting the invoice.
They contain the Entry Type, No.
(Item, Resource, G/L account or Service Contract = rental item) and serial numbers where applicable.
They also carry information about the period that is invoiced with that entry.

trans-unit.source: Prepaid Positions

seg-source.mrk: Prepaid Positions

trans-unit.source: In the case of prepaid positions, the ledger entries are divided according to calendar months.

seg-source.mrk: In the case of prepaid positions, the ledger entries are divided according to calendar months.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Ledger Entries for a prepaid order from 1/15/2019 – 3/15/2019, not month based

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Ledger Entries for a prepaid order from 1/15/2019 – 3/15/2019, not month based

trans-unit.source: The profit from the invoice is posted to a Rental Prepayment Account. The amounts have to be posted one-by-one to the Rental Account using the “Post Prepaid Rent Entries” function, accessed from the Rental Periodic Activities menu. Once this function is run, the Moved from Prepaid Acc. check box is selected on the applicable lines.

seg-source.mrk: The profit from the invoice is posted to a Rental Prepayment Account.
The amounts have to be posted one-by-one to the Rental Account using the “Post Prepaid Rent Entries” function, accessed from the Rental Periodic Activities menu.
Once this function is run, the Moved from Prepaid Acc.
check box is selected on the applicable lines.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Post Prepaid Rent Entries.htm#_Ref415222184" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Post Prepaid Rent Entries” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about running this function.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Post Prepaid Rent Entries.htm#_Ref415222184" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Post Prepaid Rent Entries” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about running this function.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Invoice the Rent Order

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Invoice the Rent Order

trans-unit.source: On February 1, 2019, you invoice the order to customer R-30000.

seg-source.mrk: On February 1, 2019, you invoice the order to customer R-30000.

trans-unit.source: Invoice the Order

seg-source.mrk: Invoice the Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to invoice the order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to invoice the order:

trans-unit.source: Open the rent order created in the “Record a Rental Position on a Rent Order” exercise.

seg-source.mrk: Open the rent order created in the “Record a Rental Position on a Rent Order” exercise.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: Review the Ledger Entries and Invoice

seg-source.mrk: Review the Ledger Entries and Invoice

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to review the rental ledger entries:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to review the rental ledger entries:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

trans-unit.source:
Notice the following:
  • The rental invoice information appears.
  • The Open check box is selected because the invoice is still pending.

<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">The rental invoice information appears.
• The Open check box is selected because the invoice is still pending.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Ledger Entries from the non-posted invoice

trans-unit.source: Close the Rental Ledger Entries page.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Rental Ledger Entries page.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab, click Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab, click Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the line to open the Service Invoice Rental page.

seg-source.mrk: Double-click the line to open the Service Invoice Rental page.

trans-unit.source: : Service Invoice for the rent order

seg-source.mrk: : Service Invoice for the rent order

trans-unit.source: Notice that the rental invoice will be posted to the Rental Account, as specified in the General Posting Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the rental invoice will be posted to the Rental Account, as specified in the General Posting Setup page.

trans-unit.source: Post the Invoice and Review the Entries

seg-source.mrk: Post the Invoice and Review the Entries

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to post the invoice and review the entries:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to post the invoice and review the entries:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the Open check box is cleared because the invoice is posted.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the Open check box is cleared because the invoice is posted.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Ledger Entries for a posted invoice

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Ledger Entries for a posted invoice

trans-unit.source: Close the Rental Ledger Entries page.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Rental Ledger Entries page.

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab of the Rent Order, notice that the Quantity Invoiced field is not updated for the rental position. This field is updated when the return is posted.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab of the Rent Order, notice that the Quantity Invoiced field is not updated for the rental position.
This field is updated when the return is posted.
